meanings.definition: A group of tropical wading birds known for their long toes and ability to walk on floating vegetation.
meanings.sent1: The jacanas gracefully navigate through the marshy areas with their long toes.
meanings.sent2: We spotted a flock of jacanas near the water's edge during our nature walk.
meanings.sent3: The jacanas decided to have a race on the lily pads, showing off their balancing skills.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves were as elegant as a jacana's walk on water.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the jacanas stood out against the green backdrop of the wetlands.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'jacana', referring to multiple birds of this species.
meanings.sent1: Look at all those jacanas gathered by the pond!
meanings.sent2: The guide pointed out the jacanas as they foraged for food in the shallows.
meanings.sent3: The jacanas held a meeting to discuss their upcoming migration plans.
meanings.sent4: The sky was filled with jacanas, a sight to behold for any bird enthusiast.
meanings.sent5: The jacanas' calls echoed across the wetlands, creating a symphony of nature.
